item.title: Navigating through Grief
item.description: My father passed away. And grief became a fever dream where I got to relive all my lost innocence. From shutting the door of the fridge to the smallest possible crease to see when the light would turn off. To the childish game of only stepping in the lithe figure of his shadow‚Ä¶ To hearing the clinks of his keys before the door would even open. I was a tower, a solid structure, built on the crumbling ground.

item.title: I was a Financial Criminal on Habbo as a Child
item.description: ‚ÄúThink‚Ä¶ Think of something that is important to you‚Ä¶‚Äù The bird chirped on the sill of the window. ‚ÄúOf how the colors blend, of the smell of packed mortadella sandwich lunches, yoghurt and gouache. Of kindergarten and sunny days. Of how happy and full your heart was. Of‚Ä¶‚Äù And then it flew away, mid-sentence, not letting my imagination catch up to what the chirps and birdsongs could‚Äôve meant. I can‚Äôt really think of anything significant.
